TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CookieHandler extends System.Object

summary.span: 提供用于读取、编写和删除会话 Cookie 的抽象基类在 HTTP 客服端上。

span.span: Provides an abstract base class for reading, writing, and deleting session cookies on an HTTP client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks (SAM) 使用的实例类，以读取、 写入和删除 cookie 的 cookie，或者包含HTTP 客户端上。The (SAM) uses an instance of the class to read, write, and delete the cookie or cookies that contain the on the HTTP client. Cookie （或 cookie，在会话令牌已拆分多个 cookie 的情况下），其中包含令牌被称为会话 cookie 的会话。The cookie (or cookies, in the case where the session token is split across several cookies) that contains the session token is known as the session cookie. Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) 附带了 chunked 的 cookie 处理程序调用的 cookie 处理程序由实现类。Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) ships with a cookie handler called the chunked cookie handler that is implemented by the class. 分块的 cookie 处理程序将拆分到根据指定的块区大小的一个或多个 cookie 的会话令牌。The chunked cookie handler splits the session token across one or more cookies according to a specified chunk size. 这是为了满足上施加的很多浏览器的单个 cookie 大小限制。This is to meet size limitations on individual cookies imposed by many browsers. 可以从派生创建自己的 cookie 处理程序。You can derive from to create your own cookie handler. 执行此操作时，必须重写， ，和方法，以执行删除、 读取和写入会话 cookie 的实际工作。When you do so, you must override the , , and methods to perform the actual work of deleting, reading, and writing the session cookie. 这些方法通常读取从 cookie集合，写入或删除 cookie集合。These methods typically read the cookie from the collection and write or delete cookies through the collection. 对象通过其可以访问请求和响应提供作为每个方法的参数。The object through which you can access the request and response is provided as a parameter to each of these methods. 除了所需的方法，可选择替代公开的其他虚拟方法属性类自定义处理程序的行为。In addition to the required methods, you can optionally override other virtual methods properties exposed by the class to customize the behavior of your handler. 多个属性公开的指定默认行为和会话 cookie 的属性的类。Several properties are exposed by the class that specify default behavior and properties for the session cookie. ， ，和属性提供 cookie，它是有效的域和在其下它存储在客户端的路径的基名称。The , , and properties supply the base name for the cookie, the domain in which it is valid and the path under which it is stored on the client. 属性指定是否对客户端脚本访问 cookie。The property specifies whether the cookie is accessible to client-side scripts. 属性指定是否应仅通过安全 (HTTPS) 连接传输 cookie。The property specifies whether the cookie should be transmitted only over secure (HTTPS) connections. 如果设置，属性用于设置于即使在浏览器关闭后保持有效的会话的过期时间为持久性会话。If set, the property is used to set the expiration time for persistent sessions, that is for sessions that remain valid even after the browser is closed. 所有这些属性具有通常会对基础设置的等效属性对象 （或对象） 处理程序的"core"方法。All of these properties have equivalent properties that are typically set on the underlying object (or objects) by the "core" methods of the handler. 有关详细信息，请参阅每个属性的文档。For more information see the documentation for each property. 可以通过的配置中指定的 cookie 处理程序由 SAM [ <cookieHandler> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md)元素。The cookie handler that is used by the SAM can be specified in configuration through the [<cookieHandler>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element. 通过此元素设置的 cookie 处理程序可以在一个事件委托中修改事件或它可以设置或直接通过访问属性。The cookie handler set by this element can be modified in an event delegate for the event or it can be set or accessed directly through the property. ## Examples 下面的示例配置 SAM 使用的类型的自定义 cookie 处理程序`MyNamespace.MyCustomCookieHandler`。The following example configures the SAM to use a custom cookie handler of type `MyNamespace.MyCustomCookieHandler`. ```xml ```

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，删除与指定请求（具有指定名称、域和路径）关联的 cookie。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, deletes the cookie associated with the specified request that has the specified name, domain, and path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从重载调用的方法来删除 cookie 的实际工作。Called from the overloaded methods to do the actual work of deleting the cookie. 方法将确保名称和路径为非空字符串。The methods will ensure that name and path are non-empty strings.

para.span: 实现是完全由开发人员。

span.span: The implementation is entirely up to the developer.

para.span: 在通常情况下，实现将替换为在指定的 cookie集合，使用 cookie 具有数据和早于当前时间; 但是，这不要求设置一个过期时间。

span.span: In the typical case, implementations replace the specified cookie in the collection, with a cookie that has data and an expiration time that is set earlier than the current time; however, this is not a requirement.

summary.span: 获取或设置用于 Cookie 的域。

span.span: Gets or sets the domain used for cookies.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 与 属性相对应。Corresponds to the property. 可以通过指定初始化该属性`domain`特性，可以在[ <cookieHandler> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md)配置中的元素。The property can be initialized by specifying the `domain` attribute on the [<cookieHandler>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element in configuration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 控制是否在编写处理程序的 cookie 的 Set-cookie 标头中发出"HttpOnly"标志。Controls whether the "HttpOnly" flag is emitted in the Set-Cookie header for cookies written by the handler. 某些 web 浏览器的客户端脚本访问 cookie 值遵循此标志。Some web browsers honor this flag by keeping client-side script from accessing the cookie value. 此属性对应于属性。This property corresponds to the property. 可以通过指定初始化该属性`hideFromScript`特性，可以在[ <cookieHandler> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md)配置中的元素。The property can be initialized by specifying the `hideFromScript` attribute on the [<cookieHandler>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element in configuration.

summary.span: 永久会话的生存期。
如果为零，将始终使用瞬变会话。

span.span: If zero, transient sessions are always used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在基于文件的 cookie，这意味着，单一登录的会话可能会继续后关闭并重新打开 web 浏览器中存储的持久性会话票证。Tickets for persistent sessions are stored in file-based cookies, meaning that the sign-in session may continue after the web browser is closed and reopened. 此属性用于设置属性。This property is used to set the property. 可以通过指定初始化该属性`persistentSessionLifetime`特性，可以在[ <cookieHandler> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md)配置中的元素。The property can be initialized by specifying the `persistentSessionLifetime` attribute on the [<cookieHandler>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element in configuration.

span.span: A value that is less than zero is specified.

summary.span: 读取 Cookie。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 控制是否有任何已编写 cookie 发出的 Set-cookie 标头中的"安全"标志。Controls whether the "Secure" flag in the Set-Cookie header is emitted for any cookies written. 如果此值为`true`，cookie 将只可通过 HTTPS 会话。If this value is `true`, the session cookies will only be available over HTTPS. 此属性对应于属性。This property corresponds to the property. 可以通过指定初始化该属性`requireSSL`特性，可以在[ <cookieHandler> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md)配置中的元素。The property can be initialized by specifying the `requireSSL` attribute on the [<cookieHandler>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element in configuration.

summary.span: 写入 cookie。

span.span: if the cookie is persistent; if the cookie is session-only, that is, only valid until the browser on the client is closed.
The expiration time for the underlying token.

summary.span: 写入当前请求（具有指定值、持久性和过期时间）关联的 cookie，。

span.span: Writes a cookie associated with the current request that has the specified value, persistence, and expiration time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`isPersistent`参数是`false`，则 cookie 到期时间设置为。If the `isPersistent` parameter is `false`, the cookie expiration time is set to . 如果`isPersistent`参数是`true`，cookie 到期时间设置为值属性，如果不是`null`或者，如果属性是`null`，过期时间设置为的值`tokenExpirationTime`参数。If the `isPersistent` parameter is `true`, the cookie expiration time is set to the value of the property if it is not `null` or, if the property is `null`, the expiration time is set to the value of the `tokenExpirationTime` parameter. 通过指定 cookie 名称、 域和路径， ，和属性。The cookie name, domain and path are specified by the , , and properties. 通过指定请求。The request is specified by . 指定是否应仅通过 SSL 发送 cookie属性和是否应从客户端脚本隐藏 cookie 由指定属性。Whether the cookie should be sent only over SSL is specified by the property and whether the cookie should be hidden from client-side scripts is specified by the property.

summary.span: 写入指定请求（具有指定名称、值和过期时间）关联的 cookie，。

span.span: Writes a cookie associated with the specified request that has the specified name, value, and expiration time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过指定 cookie 的域和路径和属性。The cookie domain and path are specified by the and properties. 通过指定请求。The request is specified by . 指定是否应仅通过 SSL 发送 cookie属性和是否应从客户端脚本隐藏 cookie 由指定属性。Whether the cookie should be sent only over SSL is specified by the property and whether the cookie should be hidden from client-side scripts is specified by the property.

summary.span: 写入指定请求（具有指定名称、值、域、路径、过期时间和可见性）关联的 cookie，。

span.span: Writes a cookie associated with the specified request that has the specified name, value, domain, path, expiration time, and visibility.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，写入与指定请求（具有指定名称、值、域、路径、过期时间、持久性和可见性）关联的 cookie。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, writes a cookie associated with the specified request that has the specified name, value, domain, path, expiration time, persistence and visibility.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从重载调用的方法来编写 cookie 的实际工作。Called from the overloaded methods to do the actual work of writing the cookie. 方法将确保`value`是一个非空字节数组，而`name`和`path`是非空字符串。The methods will ensure that `value` is a non-empty byte array and that `name` and `path` are non-empty strings.

para.span: 实现是完全由开发人员。

span.span: The implementation is entirely up to the developer.

para.span: 通常情况下，实现将 cookie 数据写入到集合，但是，这不是一项要求。

span.span: In the typical case, implementations write the cookie data to the collection, however, this is not a requirement.

para.span: 大多数参数的方法通常用于一个或多个设置等效属性对象。

span.span: Most parameters of the method are typically used to set equivalent properties on one or more objects.
